page.title: 16THE MAYFLOWER CENTRE
page.content: The Mayflower Centre costs 160,000 pounds to run each year. Edward Furness, the warden, has over thirty staff. Between 1,000 - 1,500 people use the Mayflower each week, including pensioners, unemployed, teenagers, youngsters, mums and toddlers, mums and grans, nursery groups and youth clubs, Church Fellowship, sports hall and Advice Desk. In the hungry 1930's if you went to church you would get some soup and a roll. In 1957 the Mayflower Centre was opened and run by David Sheppard. The new Sports Hall was opened by the Queen Mother in 1981. The Mayflower is a Christian Centre that serves all the family.
